title: 108_hr3972
content: The Act titled "Protecting Our Children from Violence Act of 2004" allows state social services officers access to federal databases for specific purposes. The Attorney General can grant State social services officers online access to FBI databases for criminal history checks related to abuse or neglect of minors. The Attorney General grants State social services officers access to FBI databases for missing persons checks related to investigations of missing children. State social services officers can access FBI databases for missing persons checks related to investigations of missing children. Covered officers must meet federal standards for access and be certified by the head of a state agency responsible for social services. The term "control terminal agency" refers to a criminal justice agency with access to the National Crime Information Center network. The term "State" includes the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and other U.S. territories. SEC. 3. Access to III by National Center for Missing and Exploited Children includes Case Analysis Division, Missing Children's Division, and Exploited Child Unit. Access is granted based on meeting Federal standards. SEC. 4. Privacy Protections are ensured. SEC. 4. PRIVACY PROTECTIONS. Information from checks or access under previous sections cannot be altered except for national security reasons. Information can only be released to authorized individuals, and releasing it unlawfully can result in imprisonment or fines.
